description.narrative: As a result of lessons learnt from the 2009 Padang earthquake and 2010 Pakistan floods and Pacific cyclones, AusAID has developed Emergency Response Field Deployment kits to enable Australian Government personnel to deploy quickly and effectively to the field to assess disaster impact, monitor damage, and report and implement responses. Funding under this initiative supports the supply of 150 emergency response field deployment kits and associated equipment for use by AusAID, as well as other Australian Government personnel where appropriate, who are deployed to the field in whole-of-government emergency responses. The total value of this initiative is $0.9 million over 2 years, starting 2011-12.
